subject: Management
title: The 70% Rule
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The 70% Rule.

hook.text: A director refused to delegate because nobody could do the job as well as he could.

buildup.text: He was rightâ€”at first. But his perfectionism meant the team never grew.

discovery.text: The 70% rule: if someone can do a task 70% as well as you, delegate it.

twist.text: That 70% improves over time. Your 100% stays stuck because you never have room to grow either.

climax.text: Good enough today becomes excellent tomorrowâ€”but only if you let people start.

quiz.question: What does the 70% rule suggest about delegation?
options: Delegate if someone can do the task at 70% of your quality
Only delegate tasks you can do 70% faster
Keep tasks unless someone is 100% ready
